verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass in those<WH1992> days,<WH3117> that the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH6908> their armies<WH4264> together for warfare,<WH6635> to fight<WH3898> with Israel.<WH3478> And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Know<WH3045> you assuredly,<WH3045> that you shall go<WH3318> out with me to battle,<WH4264> you and your men.<WH582>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Achish,<WH397> Surely<WH3651> you shall know<WH3045> what<WH853> <WH834> your servant<WH5650> can do.<WH6213> And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Therefore will I make<WH7760> you keeper<WH8104> of my head<WH7218> for ever.<WH3605> <WH3117>

Now Samuel<WH8050> was dead,<WH4191> and all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> had lamented<WH5594> him, and buried<WH6912> him in Ramah,<WH7414> even in his own city.<WH5892> And Saul<WH7586> had put<WH5493> away<WH5493> those<WH1992> that had familiar spirits,<WH178> and the wizards,<WH3049> out of the land.<WH776>

And the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH6908> themselves together, and came<WH935> and pitched<WH2583> in Shunem:<WH7766> and Saul<WH7586> gathered<WH6908> all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> together, and they pitched<WH2583> in Gilboa.<WH1533>
And when Saul<WH7586> saw<WH7200> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines,<WH6430> he was afraid,<WH3372> and his heart<WH3820> greatly<WH3966> trembled.<WH2729>
And when Saul<WH7586> inquired<WH7592> of the LORD,<WH3068> the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH6030> him not, neither<WH1571> by dreams,<WH2472> nor<WH1571> by Urim,<WH224> nor<WH1571> by prophets.<WH5030>

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586> to his servants,<WH5650> Seek<WH1245> me a woman<WH802> that has<WH1172> a familiar spirit,<WH178> that I may go<WH3212> to her, and inquire<WH1875> of her. And his servants<WH5650> said<WH559> to him, Behold,<WH2009> there is a woman<WH802> that has<WH1172> a familiar spirit<WH178> at Endor.<WH5874>

And Saul<WH7586> disguised<WH2664> himself, and put<WH3847> on other<WH312> raiment,<WH899> and he went,<WH3212> and two<WH8147> men<WH582> with him, and they came<WH935> to the woman<WH802> by night:<WH3915> and he said,<WH559> I pray<WH4994> you, divine<WH7080> to me by the familiar spirit,<WH178> and bring<WH5927> me him up, whom<WH853> <WH834> I shall name<WH559> to you.

And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> to him, Behold,<WH2009> you know<WH3045> what<WH853> <WH834> Saul<WH7586> has done,<WH6213> how he has cut<WH3772> off those that have familiar spirits,<WH178> and the wizards,<WH3049> out of the land:<WH776> why<WH4100> then lay you a snare<WH5367> for my life,<WH5315> to cause me to die?<WH4191>

And Saul<WH7586> swore<WH7650> to her by the LORD,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> As the LORD<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> there shall no<WH518> punishment<WH5771> happen<WH7136> to you for this<WH2088> thing.<WH1697>
Then said<WH559> the woman,<WH802> Whom<WH853> <WH4310> shall I bring<WH5927> up to you? And he said,<WH559> Bring<WH5927> me up Samuel.<WH8050>

And when the woman<WH802> saw<WH7200> Samuel,<WH8050> she cried<WH2199> with a loud<WH1419> voice:<WH6963> and the woman<WH802> spoke<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> saying,<WH559> Why<WH4100> have you deceived<WH7411> me? for you are Saul.<WH7586>

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to her, Be not afraid:<WH3372> for what<WH4100> saw<WH7200> you? And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> I saw<WH7200> gods<WH430> ascending<WH5927> out of the earth.<WH776>

And he said<WH559> to her, What<WH4100> form<WH8389> is he of? And she said,<WH559> An old<WH2205> man<WH376> comes<WH5927> up; and he is covered<WH5844> with a mantle.<WH4598> And Saul<WH7586> perceived<WH3045> that it was Samuel,<WH8050> and he stooped<WH6915> with his face<WH639> to the ground,<WH776> and bowed<WH7812> himself.

And Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> Why<WH4100> have you disquieted<WH7264> me, to bring<WH5927> me up? And Saul<WH7586> answered,<WH6030> I am sore<WH3966> distressed;<WH6887> for the Philistines<WH6430> make war<WH3898> against me, and God<WH430> is departed<WH5493> from me, and answers<WH6030> me no<WH3808> more, neither<WH1571> by prophets,<WH5030> nor<WH1571> by dreams:<WH2472> therefore I have called<WH7121> you, that you may make known<WH3045> to me what<WH4100> I shall do.<WH6213>
Then said<WH559> Samuel,<WH8050> Why<WH4100> then do you ask<WH7592> of me, seeing the LORD<WH3068> is departed<WH5493> from you, and is become<WH1961> your enemy?<WH6145>

And the LORD<WH3068> has done<WH6213> to him, as he spoke<WH1696> by me: for the LORD<WH3068> has rent<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> out of your hand,<WH3027> and given<WH5414> it to your neighbor,<WH7453> even to David:<WH1732>

Because<WH834> you obeyed<WH8085> not the voice<WH6963> of the LORD,<WH3068> nor<WH3808> executed<WH6213> his fierce<WH2740> wrath<WH639> on Amalek,<WH6002> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> has the LORD<WH3068> done<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> to you this<WH2088> day.<WH3117>

Moreover<WH1571> the LORD<WH3068> will also<WH1571> deliver<WH5414> Israel<WH3478> with you into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines:<WH6430> and to morrow<WH4279> shall you and your sons<WH1121> be with me: the LORD<WH3068> also<WH1571> shall deliver<WH5414> the host<WH4264> of Israel<WH3478> into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines.<WH6430>

Then Saul<WH7586> fell<WH5307> straightway<WH4116> all<WH4393> along<WH4393> <WH6967> on the earth,<WH776> and was sore<WH3966> afraid,<WH3372> because of the words<WH1697> of Samuel:<WH8050> and there was no<WH3808> strength<WH3581> in him; for he had eaten<WH398> no<WH3808> bread<WH3899> all<WH3605> the day,<WH3117> nor all<WH3605> the night.<WH3915>

And the woman<WH802> came<WH935> to Saul,<WH7586> and saw<WH7200> that he was sore<WH3966> troubled,<WH926> and said<WH559> to him, Behold,<WH2009> your handmaid<WH8198> has obeyed<WH8085> your voice,<WH6963> and I have put<WH7760> my life<WH5315> in my hand,<WH3709> and have listened<WH8085> to your words<WH1697> which<WH834> you spoke<WH1696> to me.

Now<WH6258> therefore, I pray<WH4994> you, listen<WH8085> you also<WH1571> to the voice<WH6963> of your handmaid,<WH8198> and let me set<WH7760> a morsel<WH6595> of bread<WH3899> before<WH6440> you; and eat,<WH398> that you may have strength,<WH3581> when<WH3588> you go<WH3212> on your way.<WH1870>

But he refused,<WH3985> and said,<WH559> I will not eat.<WH398> But his servants,<WH5650> together with the woman,<WH802> compelled<WH6555> him; and he listened<WH8085> to their voice.<WH6963> So he arose<WH6965> from the earth,<WH776> and sat<WH3427> on the bed.<WH4296>

And the woman<WH802> had a fat<WH4770> calf<WH5695> in the house;<WH1004> and she hurried,<WH4116> and killed<WH2076> it, and took<WH3947> flour,<WH7058> and kneaded<WH3888> it, and did bake<WH644> unleavened<WH4682> bread thereof:
And she brought<WH5066> it before<WH6440> Saul,<WH7586> and before<WH6440> his servants;<WH5650> and they did eat.<WH398> Then they rose<WH6965> up, and went<WH3212> away that night.<WH3915>
